meanings.definition: To extend over a large or increasing area
meanings.sent1: The grass will spread across the field.
meanings.sent2: The news about the party will spread quickly.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spread too much butter on my toast.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness spread like wildfire through the community.
meanings.sent5: The virus can spread rapidly if precautions are not taken.

meanings.definition: A soft paste or mixture that can be spread on bread or crackers
meanings.sent1: I love to eat jam spread on my toast.
meanings.sent2: The peanut butter spread was delicious on the sandwich.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate spread on the cake made it extra special.
meanings.sent4: The cheese spread on the crackers was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent5: The honey spread on the pancakes was sweet and tasty.

meanings.definition: The act of distributing or sharing something widely
meanings.sent1: The spread of flyers helped promote the event.
meanings.sent2: The spread of rumors can cause misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The generous spread of snacks at the party was appreciated by all.
meanings.sent4: The spread of knowledge is essential for progress.
meanings.sent5: The spread of happiness among friends is contagious.
